documents.content: A new implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) was placed for patient #99245-LK after recurrent ventricular tachycardia episodes. Dr. Elise Varga at Hartford Cardiac Institute noted the patient's history of arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia (ARVD). Post-implant survey indicated stable recovery with follow-up scheduled in 6 weeks. Out-of-network authorization was approved under Policy 2307-ICD.

Policy memo: Authorization requirements for ARVD patients needing ICDs updated effective Q2 2022 (Policy 2307-ICD). Preauthorization department received delegated authority from group medical directors to extend coverage based on new AHA diagnostic thresholds. Implementation begins April 10 - all coded as Case Type 45A.

Hartford Cardiac Institute quarterly report shows ICD implantation rates increased 22% following Policy 2307-ICD adjustments. Notable case: Follow-up assessment confirms Rita Corvalis (ID#99245-LK) maintained sinus rhythm using programmed ATP therapy, avoiding shocks. 89% approvals under new policy vs. 67% historically.

Media release: Local entrepreneur establishes Wentworth Cardiac Fund to support ARVD patients with high-deductible plans. Program launches May 15 - applications via hartfordcardiac.org/fund. Mentioned case: Rita C., 42, benefitted from expanded policy 2307-ICD coverage during treatment at Hartford Cardiac's Electrophysiology Lab.

Internal audit sampled 47 ICD cases under Policy 2307-ICD:Hartford Cardiac Institute used correct modifiers (79% accuracy vs regional avg 43%). Discrepancies found in 2/5 device brand documentation cases. Rita Corvalis (ID99245-LK) file showed complete documentation with Boston Scientific device coding.

Enrollment survey from Hartford Cardiac's DigiHealth program shows 42% of ARVD patients under 45 preferred mobile monitoring. Remark: 'The ATP feature prevented emergency visits for me every month' - participant RC logged 27 ATP successes in Q3. Pilot expansion evaluation due October 5.
